title: master yi ????????????????????????????????????????????
body: Please nerf yi that champ is a joke and does way way way to much damage for how easy they are to play both champions DID  NOT NEED  buff and im not sure what riot were thinking buffing them

replies.body: Yi is extremely easy to deal with i see no issue.

Sarcasm? 

Because that depends 100% on who you play.
Maybe for you tanky junglers with lots of disrupt he is easy.

But you try fending him off as Aurelion Sol in a solo lane....

I mean in general. Usually if u see a master yi picked someone picks some heavy CC champ and yi becomes a non issue. In my experience anyway. 

Tis a team game after all.

In my experience, things go less smoothly:

**-Game 1-**

Yi is picked.

Someone picks a champ with heavy CC.

Yi ganks other less dangerous people all early game, gets few early kills.

Team fight begins, Yi comes in late _(as Yi's do)_, starts attacking ADC.

Heavy CC user notices, re-positions themselves within the fight, fires their CC at Yi _(assuming they haven't used it already on Draven or Kat or any number of just-as-lethal threats)_.

ADC is of course dead by this point. A half-decent Yi dodges the CC with a well timed alpha-strike. Proceeds to eliminate next target.

**-Game 2- **

Yi is picked.

Two people pick heavy CC users, so at least one of them can hit Yi after alpha-strike.

Yi ganks other less dangerous lanes all early game, gets a few early kills.

Team fight begins, Yi comes in late _(as Yi's do)_, starts attacking ADC.

Heavy CC user 1 has been staying next to ADC, just for this occasion. Heavy CC user 1 fires their CC.

Yi dodges CC with alpha-strike, most likely killing ADC in the process.

Heavy CC user 2 notices, re-positions themselves within the fight, fires their CC at Yi.

Yi is hit, two heavy CC users proceed to take down Yi. 3 people (one dead) are now focused on Yi.

Other 4 members of Yi's team decimate remaining 2 members of enemy team left alone. Then turn on remaining heavy CC users. creating two 4v2's. 

_______________

Its not hard to imagine what games 3 and 4 look like.
Game 5 begins with a Yi ban of course.

And this is all under the assumption that 

1. people actually pick heavy CC users in the first place.
2. heavy CC champs have quick-firing accurate CC, not slow or hard to use CC like Swain's E etc.
3. people don't use their CC on Draven/Kat/Vayne etc _(who are just as high a priority)_.
4. people can actually HIT Yi with the CC and not miss or have it dodged.
5. enough people still remain alive/focused-on rest of enemy team.

Thats a hell of a lot of 'ifs' just to deal with 1 champ.

I find lulu with polymorph is highly effective against a yi. Is lulu still a contested pick? 

Just in my general experience I've never had any trouble dealing with yi.
There's nothing wrong with yi. if you lose to a yi then you probably deserve to have lost.

over time the average skill level of the player base has gone up. yi use to be known as shit in high elo and godly in low elo (this was because low elo players couldn't deal with him wouldn't group and would miss/not use cc)  but now hes shit in all elos (outside of 1tricks). if you couldn't kill aurelion in a lane than what is he suppose to do.

i use to play yi all  the time but now i almost never play him now since it feels like the only time im useful is when the enemy team ints over a few kills but even then if the enemy team has some cc or if one of my lanes is loosing its straight back to useless.

i don't think yi needs to be nerfed or buffed, either the game itself needs to slow down or he needs a rework


also if you get  caught in the jungle or in a lane by yourself i don't see why a assassin/hypercarry hybrid (though assassin is debatable) shouldn't be able to kill you, thats like saying i face checked veigar why wont rito nerf him

Maybe because i'm a thresh main i see no issue, but like yi is very easy to stop, if you're gonna play AuSol, ban him so you don't have to deal with him, or better yet, Don't play AuSol, he's crap he does no dmg, he has minimal roam now (Talon/Talyah is a better pick). Yi is only a problem for people who lack the understanding of Hard CC, or picking for the team

What annoys me is the logic behind buffing Yi in any way.

_"He's not played much in high elo, better buff him so he's viable there. We wouldn't want the pros missing out on that fun play style."_

Yea... good idea! Lets gets all pissy because the champ you made for **teaching beginners the game** isn't being pick-or-banned in worlds...

Nice logic Riot. Now we've got a champ whos too strong for the elo he's meant for, and still won't be played at worlds... because he's the **f*cking beginner champ!**
